intro: Scabiosa comosa, commonly known as the common scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and wildflower meadows. Scabiosa comosa is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
